current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide Federal death and disability benefits for
		  contractors who serve as firefighters of the Forest Service, Department of the
		  Interior agencies, or any State or local entity.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text: Fallen Wildland Firefighters Fair Compensation Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text:
Death and
			 disability benefits for contracted firefighters of the Forest Service,
			 Department of the Interior agencies, or any State or local entity

text.#text:
Aerial and ground
			 crew firefighters used to fight wildfires often work on a contract basis with a
			 State, local, or Federal agency and, as a result, are not eligible for death or
			 disability benefits should they be killed or injured in the line of
			 duty.

Employer death
			 benefits and life insurance for exclusive-use firefighters are expensive, and
			 the families of these heroes have to cope not only with the loss of a loved
			 one, but also the additional financial loss of a wage earner.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
continue to encourage the recruitment and retention of brave, skilled
			 firefighters.

is amended by adding at the
			 end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 308 of the Federal Land
			 Policy and Management Act of 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:308

header.#text:
Eligibility for
			 death and disability benefits

Eligibility of
				contracted firefighters for death and disability benefits

text.#text:
An
				individual shall be eligible for a death or disability benefit under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
				1201 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968/s:1201

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
as a contractor or subcontractor of such a
				public agency, in an official capacity, with or without compensation;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:308/ss:c/p:2

text.#text:
serves a public
				agency specified in

performs under an
				exclusive use, call when needed, or equipment rental agreement contract with
				the public agency; and

directly performs
				fire suppression activities as a member of an aerial or ground-based
				firefighting crew or equipment operator in the direct fire suppression, or en
				route to or return from such direct fire suppression activity.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:308/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and any State and local
				firefighting entity.

text.#text:
This
				subsection shall apply with respect to death or injuries occurring on or after
				January 1, 1985. The amount of the benefit paid shall be the eligible amount
				under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
at the time of death or
				injury.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 1201 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968/s:1201

header.#text:
Eligibility of
			 firefighters for public safety officer death benefits
